intro: Limonium kossmatii, commonly known as the coastal flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and spikes of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in coastal environments, tolerating salty air and sandy soils. Limonium kossmatii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize dunes. Its flowers bloom in late summer, adding color to coastal landscapes.
